metadata.title: AWS re:Invent 2025: Top 10 Announcements
metadata.description: Discover the most impactful announcements from AWS re:Invent 2025 with interactive quizzes
metadata.author: AWS Solutions Architect

slides.title: Think you can keep up with re:Invent?

content.text: 10 announcements. 11 questions. Points for speed AND accuracy.
üéØ The Challenge: Each announcement has a quiz. Answer correctly AND quickly to maximize your score. 1,200 points possible. Can you reach 70% to pass?
Top 3 You Can't Miss:

items.title: Werner's Farewell
items.description: 14 years. One mic drop. The most emotional moment of the conference.

items.title: Frontier Agents
items.description: AI that works independently for days, not minutes. Autonomous. Actually autonomous.

items.title: Database Savings
items.description: Proving cost optimization can steal the show from GenAI announcements.

content.text: ‚è±Ô∏è Speed matters! You have 15-20 seconds per question. Think fast, click faster.
Ready to test your re:Invent knowledge?
Simplifying cost optimization across managed databases
Addressing years of customer requests for simpler database cost management with flexible commitment plans
Matt Garman's complete keynote on YouTube

items: Covers RDS, Aurora, Redshift, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, MemoryDB
1-year usage commitments with flexible allocation
Early adopters: SmugMug, Vanguard

content.text: Six Years of Complaining Finally Pays Off
content.author: Corey Quinn, Chief Cloud Economist, Duckbill Group

content.text: The hot new thing at AWS re:Invent has nothing to do with AI
content.author: GeekWire

content.text: üí° Enterprises prioritize cost management alongside AI innovation

slides.question: What was the audience's reaction when Matt Garman announced Database Savings Plans?

choices.text: Standing ovation with tears of joy üò≠

slides.explanation: Database Savings Plans got enthusiastic applause! Cost optimization resonates strongly with customers managing large-scale database workloads. It shows that practical operational improvements matter just as much as cutting-edge innovation.
slides.funFact: Corey Quinn (Chief Cloud Economist, Duckbill Group) titled his analysis 'Six Years of Complaining Finally Pays Off' - persistence pays off!

content.text: Autonomous AI working independently for hours or days
A new class of AI agents that operate without continuous human intervention

items.title: Kiro Agent
items.description: Virtual developer learning from PRs and code reviews. Updates 15+ repos from single prompt.

items.title: Security Agent
items.description: Transforms pentesting from weeks to hours. Proactively scans design docs.

items.title: DevOps Agent
items.description: Autonomous on-call engineer. 86%+ root cause identification rate.

content.text: The other 70% is consumed by meetings, documentation, and ticket management

slides.question: According to AWS, what percentage of time do developers actually spend coding?
slides.explanation: Only 30%! The rest is meetings, documentation, and tickets. Frontier Agents aim to help developers reclaim that lost 70%. Finally, robots taking the boring meetings!
slides.funFact: Kiro is used by 'hundreds of thousands of developers' at Amazon. That's a lot of virtual coworkers!

content.text: The Renaissance Developer and verification debt
Amazon CTO Werner Vogels delivered his 14th and final re:Invent keynote, ending with a literal mic drop (play the quiz to the end to see it üòâ)
Werner Vogels' complete keynote on YouTube
üéØ Renaissance Developers: Curious, judgment-wielding, community-connected
Will AI take my job? Maybe. Will AI make me obsolete? Absolutely not, if you evolve.
content.author: Werner Vogels

items: Introduced 'verification debt' - AI generating code faster than humans understand it
Developers with curiosity and judgment will thrive in the AI era
Emphasized the need for proper oversight of AI-generated code
Created viral moment across Twitter and LinkedIn

slides.question: What new concept did Werner Vogels introduce in his final keynote?
slides.explanation: 'Verification debt' - when AI generates code faster than humans can understand it. It's like technical debt's evil twin that sneaks up on you while you're not looking!
slides.funFact: Werner literally dropped the mic and said 'Werner, out.' After 14 years, he earned that moment!

content.text: Reliable state management for serverless workflows
Serverless code that maintains state reliably from seconds to one full year, eliminating fragile workarounds

items: Pause and wait for long-running background tasks
Automatically survives failures and resumes execution
Addresses massive user base pain point
Combined with Lambda Managed Instances for hybrid flexibility

content.text: üéØ Bridging serverless convenience with infrastructure control

slides.question: How long can Lambda Durable Functions maintain state?

choices.text: Up to 1 hour - good for coffee breaks ‚òï
Up to 1 year - forget about it! üóìÔ∏è

slides.explanation: One full year! That's enough time to start a business, run a marathon training program, or wait for the next re:Invent. Lambda just got patient!
slides.funFact: Lambda processes over 15 trillion requests monthly. That's about 2,000 requests for every person on Earth!

content.text: Custom AI model development at enterprise scale
Four new Nova models plus Nova Forge 'open training' for building custom frontier models

items.title: Nova 2 Lite
items.description: Fast, cost-effective reasoning with million-token context

items.title: Nova 2 Pro
items.description: Most intelligent reasoning for complex agentic tasks

items: Blend proprietary data with Amazon's curated datasets
Reddit built custom frontier model replacing multiple specialized models
Note: Custom models must remain on Bedrock - no model weight exports

slides.question: What's the catch with Nova Forge custom models?

choices.text: You can't export model weights - Bedrock only üîí
They require daily sacrifices of GPU hours üî•
Werner has to personally approve each model üë¥

slides.explanation: Custom models must remain on Amazon Bedrock - you can't export model weights. This is an architectural design decision to ensure optimal integration with Bedrock's governance, security, and scaling capabilities. Consider this when evaluating build vs. buy decisions for frontier models.
slides.funFact: Reddit built their own frontier model with Nova Forge, replacing multiple specialized models. One model to rule them all!

content.text: Next-generation processors for compute and AI training
AWS's most powerful custom silicon yet, with CEO Andy Jassy personally highlighting the milestone

items: Customers: Apple, Adobe, Airbnb, Epic Games, Formula 1, Anthropic
Trainium4 preview with NVIDIA NVLink Fusion interoperability

content.text: This infrastructure strength, not the AI models, is where AWS's expertise really lies.
content.author: Ethan Feller, Zacks Analyst

slides.question: How much more compute performance does Trainium3 deliver compared to its predecessor?
slides.explanation: 4.4x more compute performance! That's like upgrading from a bicycle to a Ferrari. And it's 4x more energy efficient too - fast AND eco-friendly!
slides.funFact: AWS has deployed over 1 million Trainium chips. That's enough silicon to make a very expensive beach!

content.text: Deploying AI agents safely at enterprise scale
Enterprise-ready governance, compliance, and audit capabilities for production AI agents

items: Policy: Cedar guardrails (e.g., block refunds over $1,000)
13 built-in evaluators for continuous quality assessment
Episodic Memory: Agents learn from past interactions

content.text: üè¢ From experimental chatbots to production systems with full enterprise controls

slides.question: How much faster did PGA TOUR achieve content writing with AgentCore?
slides.explanation: 1,000% faster (that's 10x)! PGA TOUR also achieved 95% cost reduction. That's what we call a hole-in-one! ‚õ≥
slides.funFact: MongoDB pushed an agent app to production in 8 weeks instead of months. Even their database is getting faster!

content.text: Developer tooling for AI-powered workflows
Enhanced development environments and SDKs that eliminate traditional agent framework overhead

items.title: Kiro IDE
features: Kiro Powers: Unified MCP tools packaging

content.text: Frontier models are so capable that the more structure you add around them, the worse your agent gets
content.author: AWS Developer Advocates

slides.question: What percentage of traditional agent frameworks is just 'structural glue code'?
slides.explanation: 90%! Traditional frameworks are mostly structural glue code. Strands aims to eliminate this overhead. It's like removing the cardboard from a cereal box - what you really want is the cereal (code)!
slides.funFact: Strands SDK has 5+ million downloads. That's a lot of developers wanting less glue!

content.text: Managed AI infrastructure deployed in your data center
Addressing data sovereignty and regulatory compliance with on-premises AWS-managed AI infrastructure

items: Combines NVIDIA GPUs and Trainium chips
Full AWS services: Bedrock, SageMaker, and more
Perfect for GDPR and sector-specific regulations
15-year NVIDIA partnership highlighted

content.text: üåç Keep data on-premises while leveraging AWS managed infrastructure

content.label: AI Chips in Saudi HUMAIN AI Zone

content.text: Really compelling and potentially AWS's most significant announcement
content.author: Ethan Feller, Zacks Analyst

slides.question: What's the main benefit of AWS AI Factories for enterprises?
slides.explanation: Data sovereignty and regulatory compliance! AI Factories let you keep data on-premises while getting AWS managed infrastructure. Perfect for strict GDPR requirements or industries with heavy regulations!
slides.funFact: Saudi Arabia's HUMAIN is building an AI Zone with up to 150,000 AI chips. That's a LOT of artificial intelligence in one place!

content.text: Agentic code modernization for legacy applications
Using AI agents to tackle technical debt and modernize legacy codebases at scale

content.label: Team Time Spent on Tech Debt

content.title: Customer Results
items: Air Canada: 80% reduction in modernization time and cost
Thomson Reuters: 1.5M lines of code processed monthly
Up to 70% reduction in maintenance and licensing costs

content.text: üí∞ Practical, measurable ROI with documented productivity gains

slides.question: How much code does Thomson Reuters process monthly with AWS Transform?

choices.text: 1.5M lines - that's a LOT of code! üìö

slides.explanation: 1.5 million lines of code per month! That's roughly equivalent to rewriting Windows 95 every month. Thomson Reuters is doing Windows to Linux migration at massive scale!
slides.funFact: Air Canada achieved 80% reduction in time and cost modernizing thousands of Lambda functions. That's the power of agentic code transformation at scale!

content.text: The shift to autonomous AI and measurable developer gains

items: From AI assistants to autonomous agents working independently
Cost management and practical ROI remain critical priorities
Developer productivity improvements are quantifiable and significant
Werner's Renaissance Developer: curiosity, judgment, community
Infrastructure and custom silicon as AWS's core advantage

content.text: AI won't make developers obsolete if they evolve. The Renaissance Developer‚Äîcurious, judgment-wielding, community-connected‚Äîthrives with AI tools.
content.author: Werner Vogels

slides.question: FINAL CHALLENGE: Which moment generated the most EMOTIONAL response at re:Invent 2025?

choices.text: Frontier Agents - autonomous AI is cool! ü§ñ

slides.explanation: Werner Vogels' final keynote after 14 years was the most emotionally resonant moment. His literal mic drop and 'Werner, out' created a viral moment celebrating his legacy. While Database Savings Plans got strong applause for practical value, Werner's farewell connected with the community on a personal level that transcended any product announcement.
slides.funFact: Werner Vogels has been the voice of AWS technical philosophy since the beginning. His 'Renaissance Developer' concept and focus on builder culture shaped how millions of developers think about cloud architecture. After 14 keynotes, his final appearance reminded everyone that behind the technology are people who genuinely care about the craft.

content.text: Thanks for playing this quiz, you're amazing!
Werner Vogels' complete keynote on YouTube

images.description: Werner Vogels delivering his final keynote
